comments.body:
Couple of questions/reviews. 

1. cruft 1.4.0 has different dependencies than the ones you have listed below. Master has 2.0 deps but that is pending a pypi release.

2. How is version bumping handled here? Do we need to explicitly update this every time?

conda-forge has a bot that checks for updates on pypi, so when a new release happens, a PR should be automatically opened. It won't fix the dependency changes (that has to be done manually), but you can edit the PR or just open a new one. If there aren't any changes needed except for the version bump and sha256 update (which the bot handles automatically), then you can merge once the CI passes.
Looking into this today and will fix the dependencies to reflect the PyPI release. Thanks for the clarification, @synapticarbors!
Poetry should not be needed for installs. Just a new enough version of pip that supports pep517
Since we are building from source and we don't want `pip` to go out and download `poetry` (we want it coming from a conda channel), `poetry` should be listed under `host`.

It looks like this package contains an entry point. Please add it:

https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda-build/en/latest/resources/define-metadata.html#python-entry-points

Also add a `commands` test in the `test` section below:

https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda-build/en/latest/resources/define-metadata.html#test-commands
